creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
description: Panel of gold k'ossu with spreading branches of lotus and peonies in the rain field. Above, in a wide band set off from the field by a border of blue k'ossu with Greek Key meander in gold, is a row of flower and fruit sprays. The design is done in shades of red, pink, green and white. Around the edge a the border of the Greek key meander in gold on blue. The panel is in two sections seamed up the middle. Lining of bright pink figured silk. Coarse quality. Note A.P. says this may be late XVIII century.
title: Panel
